Dear Celia Thomas:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 6/4/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
• (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise
outside of the direct supervision of staff, staff
shall perform variable interval, eye-on checks of
residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
I reviewed bed check logs for five current residents. Checks are being completed
at quarter hour intervals rather than variable intervals.
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (5) The social service supervisor shall approve,
countersign, and date the initial treatment plan.
One of one ITP did not have the supervisor's signature.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (4) The social service worker shall sign and date
the initial treatment plan.
One of one UTP was not signed by the social service worker.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (5) The social service supervisor shall approve,
countersign, and date the updated treatment
plan.
One of one UTP was not signed by the social service supervisor.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• I recommended the facility develop three or four sets of predetermined variable
interval bed check sheets for staff to utilize when performing room checks.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• I clarified the difference between Licensee Designee and Chief Administrator
to the perspective new Chief Administrator and followed up with her on the
fingerprint process as well as the new CAP entry process in CWLM.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
I reviewed the agency's financial statement for 2023. There were no financial
concerns identified.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The current Licensee Designee is retiring in September 2024 and a new one is
being recruited by the Board of Directors. The facility recently applied to change
the Chief Administrator from Celia Thomas to Carolyn Rayford. Ms. Rayford
qualifies as Chief Administrator and is in the process of obtaining fingerprints.
There were no special investigations or corrective action plans during the current
licensing period.

Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff enjoy working at the facility and expressed no concerns.
The youths interviewed had positive things to say about the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
I observed the kitchen, freezer, refrigerator, pantry, dining room, youth bedrooms,
general living area, staff office, medication log and medication cabinet. The facility
was clean and organized.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
